xocs:funding.xocs:funding-agency-matched-string: EU H2020 Research and Innovation Programme
European Union’s Horizon 2020 Research and Innovation Programme

xocs:funding-list.xocs:funding-text: Manuscript received August 15, 2018; revised November 17, 2018; accepted November 25, 2018. Date of publication January 1, 2019; date of current version April 13, 2020. Manuscript received in final form December 3, 2018. This work was supported in part by the H2020 ERC Starting under Grant BUCOPHSYS, in part by the Swedish Research Council (VR), in part by the Knut och Alice Wallenberg Foundation (KAW), in part by the European Union’s Horizon 2020 Research and Innovation Programme (AEROWORKS) under Grant 644128, in part by the Swedish Foundation for Strategic Research (SSF), and in part by the EU H2020 Research and Innovation Programme (Co4Robots) under Grant 731869. Recommended by Associate Editor A. G. Aghdam. (Corresponding author: Christos K. Verginis.) The authors are with the Centre for Autonomous Systems and ACCESS Linnaeus Centre, KTH Royal Institute of Technology, 10044 Stockholm, Sweden (e-mail: cverginis@kth.se; matteoma@kth.se; dimos@kth.se).

organization.$: Centre for Autonomous Systems and Access Linnaeus Centre

affiliation.ce:source-text: Centre for Autonomous Systems and ACCESS Linnaeus Centre, KTH Royal Institute of Technology, Stockholm, Sweden

head.citation-title: Robust cooperative manipulation without force/torque measurements: Control design and experiments
head.abstracts: © 1993-2012 IEEE.This paper presents two novel control methodologies for the cooperative manipulation of an object by N robotic agents. First, we design an adaptive control protocol which employs quaternion feedback for the object orientation to avoid potential representation singularities. Second, we propose a control protocol that guarantees predefined transient and steady-state performance for the object trajectory. Both methodologies are decentralized, since the agents calculate their own signals without communicating with each other, as well as robust to external disturbances and model uncertainties. Moreover, we consider that the grasping points are rigid and avoid the need for force/torque measurements. Load distribution is also included via a grasp matrix pseudoinverse to account for potential differences in the agents' power capabilities. Finally, simulation and experimental results with two robotic arms verify the theoretical findings.

coredata.dc:description: This paper presents two novel control methodologies for the cooperative manipulation of an object by N robotic agents. First, we design an adaptive control protocol which employs quaternion feedback for the object orientation to avoid potential representation singularities. Second, we propose a control protocol that guarantees predefined transient and steady-state performance for the object trajectory. Both methodologies are decentralized, since the agents calculate their own signals without communicating with each other, as well as robust to external disturbances and model uncertainties. Moreover, we consider that the grasping points are rigid and avoid the need for force/torque measurements. Load distribution is also included via a grasp matrix pseudoinverse to account for potential differences in the agents' power capabilities. Finally, simulation and experimental results with two robotic arms verify the theoretical findings.
coredata.dc:title: Robust cooperative manipulation without force/torque measurements: Control design and experiments
coredata.prism:publicationName: IEEE Transactions on Control Systems Technology
coredata.dc:publisher: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers Inc.
